title: [BUG] ReconcilerForecaster does not support exogenous data out of the box
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
If the sktime example is adapted to a forecaster with exogenous data it fails.


**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import temporal_train_test_split
from sktime.forecasting.exp_smoothing import ExponentialSmoothing
from sktime.transformations.hierarchical.reconcile import Reconciler
from sktime.transformations.hierarchical.aggregate import Aggregator
from sktime.utils._testing.hierarchical import _bottom_hier_datagen
from sktime.transformations.series.date import TempAgg
import numpy as np
fh = 7
y = _bottom_hier_datagen(
    no_bottom_nodes=3,
    no_levels=1,
    random_seed=123,
)
y_train, y_test = temporal_train_test_split(y, test_size=fh)
# first we show how it does work
f0 = Aggregator()*Aggregator()**ReconcilerForecaster(SARIMAX(), method='td_fcst')
f0.fit(y=y_train, X=y_train)
prds = f0.predict(fh=list(range(1, fh+1)), X=y_test)
# now a failure is shown
f1 = ReconcilerForecaster(SARIMAX(), method='td_fcst')
f1.fit(y=y_train, X=y_train)
# following fails
prds = f1.predict(fh=list(range(1, fh+1)), X=y_test)
```
Error
```python
   1749 if methodname != "update_predict_single":
-> 1750     y_preds += [method(X=Xs[i], **kwargs)]
   1751 else:
   1752     y_preds += [method(y=ys[ix], X=Xs[i], **kwargs)]

IndexError: list index out of range
```


**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
No error.
